body: I can reproduce it on Mac with Safari Version 12.0.2 (12606.3.4.1.4) and Waterfox 56.2.6 (64-bit) with Syncthing v1.0.0, macOS (64 bit) This is how it looks like:

Does the same thing on Windows in Opera, Vivaldi and Chrome.

I temporarily fixed this by adding top:200px in the dev console to move it down. I then discovered that the date picker doesn't work at all and is stuck on 1969 and 1970!

![figure-1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25500388/55552365-11502a80-56d5-11e9-952f-aa5a996bf1a0.png)
There is also a ticket for that but the later is I think browser related.

Is this actually a bug?

I mean, this only happens if there are no files in `.stversions` (as you can see by the cut-off "No data." string in the screenshots). Obviously, the date picker does not work in such a case. I guess that maybe the filter input fields should be disabled if there are no files to restore?

**Edit**:

Not a bug per se, but really the Versions button should be disabled if the versions folder is empty. Now, it seems the button becomes available as soon as the folder has been created, regardless of whether there are actually any files inside it.

issue.title: gui: Tweak the Restore Versions modal for better usability

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
Add various tweaks to the Restore Versions modal in order to make it more usable in general. In the process, upgrade both fancytree and daterangepicker to their newest versions. The important changes in details are as follows. 1. Wrap the table in a container, which is user-resizable, by default occupying as much space as needed within the screen. This prevents the generation of a giant list pushing everything down the screen, and also keeps the filter, date picker, and buttons visible. 2. Apply various usability tweaks, including support for long filenames, ensuring proper functionality on all resolutions, widening the input fields to fit more text, etc. 3. Upgrade the theme to match the rest of the Web GUI, including using the same set of icons. Ensure that everything works correctly in all supported themes. 4. Upgrade fancytree from 2.28.1 to 2.38.0, and daterangepicker from 3.0.0 to 3.1. In the process, remove all pre-defined fancytree themes and create our own in css/assets instead. This is because it takes much less code to write a theme from scratch for our use case than to override the complex pre-defined one. Signed-off-by: Tomasz Wilczy≈Ñski ## Screenshots Before & After
Light Theme (desktop) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5626656/134809185-e55d12a0-f3c1-46fb-920c-87569fe2d025.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5626656/134884553-6816120a-ee41-47ab-a610-7a8911b772fd.png)

Light Theme (phone)
